[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Bath Data Archive (BDA) defines requirements for managing, depositing, and accessing research datasets.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: BDA supports dataset deposits, metadata, licensing, embargoes, and controlled access.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: BDA integrates with CRIS, LDAP, and APIs for authentication and metadata.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: BDA provides web workflows for deposits and updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: BDA operates on scalable university infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: BDA supports REST APIs for deposits and retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: BDA ensures secure HTTPS-based data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: BDA is optimized for handling large datasets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: BDA ensures 24/7 uptime with automated monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: BDA supports multilingual metadata and localized access policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: BDA links to repositories, indexing tools, and metadata aggregators.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: BDA supports deposits, licensing, embargoes, and metadata tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: BDA serves researchers, administrators, and funders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: BDA depends on university infrastructure, network stability, and external integrations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Requires compliance with archival standards and persistent identifiers.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with CRIS and LDAP for authentication and metadata exchange.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide APIs for automated dataset deposits.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support metadata harvesting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall manage licensing, embargoes, and controlled access (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enforce role-based dataset access (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall link datasets to DMPs and publications (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive web-based interface (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process metadata updates within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 3,000 users without performance degradation (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata in a relational database with indexing.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage dataset versions and track changes.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and funding body standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt all stored and transmitted data.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 14721 for digital preservation.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall provide role-based access.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Schemas, API docs, and system diagrams.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 14721, GDPR, and SWORD2 API documentation.
